title: Biträdande Restaurangchef hos O’Learys
description:
**Biträdande Restaurangchef** **hos O’Learys Hemavan**

**Om tjänsten:** Vi söker nu en driven och erfaren hovmästare för att arbeta tillsammans med vårt team på **Hemavan**. Som hovmästare är du ansvarig för att säkerställa att vår restaurang fungerar smidigt och levererar enastående service till våra gäster. Din roll innebär att driva verksamheten operativt, samt att vara en förebild för ditt team och en representant för restaurangen utåt. Rollen innefattar arbete vissa helger.


**Om dig**: Vi letar efter dig som värderar likabehandling och respekt gentemot både kollegor och gäster. Din passion för mat, service och att skapa minnesvärda gästupplevelser kommer att vara avgörande för din roll hos oss. Vi söker dig som kommer vara stolt medlem i O'Learys-familjen och som strävar efter att upprätthålla en hög standard och kvalitet i allt du gör, både individuellt och som en del av vårt team.


**I arbetsuppgifterna ingår** **att:**  



* Ledarskap och utveckling av teamet för att säkerställa att våra gemensamma mål uppnås
* Att vara aktiv i den dagliga driften och säkerställa en fantastisk gästupplevelse varje gång
* Följa rutiner och policys enligt anvisningar från ledningen
* Lägga beställningar
* Hantera större grupp bokningar

**Önskad erfarenhet och egenskaper:**


* Erfarenhet från restaurangbranschen, önskvärt från O’Learys
* Erfarenhet av ledarskap och medarbetaransvar
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av Caspeco Cloud kassasystem
* Resultatinriktad, lösningsorienterad och förmåga att driva arbete självständigt
* Utmärkta kommunikations- och ledarskapsförmågor
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en snabbt föränderlig miljö

**Låter det här som något för** **dig?**

Tveka inte att söka tjänsten redan idag, intervjuer sker löpande. Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta **linnea.norberg@olearys.se**. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**  

  



* Personlig utveckling
* Möjlig karriärstege
* Kollektivavtal

**Start: 1 Juli - 30 september**

**Omfattning: 75% säsongsanställning**

**Arbetstider:** Kvällar och helger

**Plats: Hemavan**

**Om** **O’Learys:**

O’Learys är mer än bara en restaurang. Det är ett nöjescentrum som utöver kärleken till sport, mat, dryck och god stämning är en mötesplats fylld av aktiviteter och nöjen alla dagar i veckan. Utöver vårt stora aktivitetsutbud med allt för både stora och små, erbjuder vi även live evenemang och konserter med några av Sveriges största DJ’s, band och artister.


*Vi tror på forskningsbaserade och objektiva utvärderingsmetoder som stöd i arbetet att hitta rätt person till rätt roll. Av den anledningen använder vi Alva* *Labs assessmentmetoder i våra* *rekryteringsprocesser för att hjälpa oss identifiera kandidater med störst sannolikhet att trivas och passa rollen.*

title: Salesforce CRM Specialist at Nexer Group
description:
**Do you live and breathe Salesforce? Are you passionate about leveraging its power to drive business growth?**


Nexer Group is looking for an experienced and enthusiastic Salesforce CRM Specialist to join our team and play a key role in optimizing our Salesforce environment. You'll be a vital part of ensuring our systems are running smoothly and efficiently, enabling our teams to maximize their productivity and deliver outstanding results.

**What You'll Do:**

* **Champion Salesforce:** Take ownership of our Salesforce instance, acting as the go-to expert for all things Salesforce related.
* **Enhance and Optimize:** Continuously improve our Salesforce configuration, identifying opportunities to streamline processes and enhance user experience through customizations, flows, and automation.
* **Problem Solver:** Troubleshoot issues, resolve bugs, and implement solutions to ensure seamless operation of our Salesforce platform.
* **Collaboration is Key:** Work closely with various teams across Nexer Group to gather requirements, understand their needs, and translate them into effective Salesforce solutions.
* **Data Driven:** Maintain data quality, create insightful reports and dashboards, and analyze key metrics to drive informed decision-making.
* **Stay Ahead of the Curve:** Keep up-to-date with the latest Salesforce releases, features, and best practices to ensure we're leveraging the full potential of the platform.

**We're Looking for Someone With:**

* **Deep Salesforce Expertise:** Extensive experience as a Salesforce Administrator or Consultant, with a strong understanding of Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and the Lightning Platform. Salesforce certifications are a major plus!
* **Configuration Guru:** Proven ability to configure Salesforce to meet business needs, including creating custom objects, fields, page layouts, workflows, and validation rules.
* **Flow Master:** Experience building and implementing Salesforce flows to automate processes and improve efficiency.
* **Analytical Mindset:** Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex requirements into actionable solutions.1
* **Communication is Crucial:** Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.2
* **Passion for Technology:** A genuine enthusiasm for Salesforce and a desire to stay at the forefront of CRM technology.

**Nexer as an employer**


At Nexer, we think that every new idea, every innovation and new acquaintance is a promise of a better future. For you, for our customers and for the world we live in.


The future is not a distant dream, it is created by the actions we do today. At Nexer, you get the opportunity to dream big, think smart and make sure things happen. We take visionary ideas and create concrete strategies. We use technology as a tool for progress and find new ways to communicate.


We work value-driven and put our heart into everything we do. You get close to those who make decisions and you can always be involved and influence. If you work at Nexer, you get a strong employer with an international presence and great opportunities to develop.

**Application**


Please, go ahead and submit your application below. Unfortunately, we are not able to handle applications via e-mail, but if you have questions about the position or Nexer, please contact Joakim Hampus at Joakim.hampus@nexergroup.com We accept applications on an ongoing basis, so do not wait to apply!


We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer - Platform Focus
description:
**This is Mevisio**
-------------------


Mevisio is a powerful platform designed to elevate operational performance for leaders and teams, driving efficiency through smart visualization and enhanced communication. Our application transforms traditional whiteboards into interactive touch screens, displaying real-time KPIs and activities tailored to each client's needs. Trusted by global companies and digital leaders, Mevisio is deployed in over 3,000 facilities across 60+ countries, with more than half of our revenue coming from international markets.


Our customizable platform integrates seamlessly with other systems, supporting clients in diverse industries, particularly manufacturing and healthcare, where Lean principles thrive. By reducing waste and boosting safety and sustainability, Mevisio empowers organizations to achieve operational excellence and improve their overall performance.

### **Why Mevisio?**

At Mevisio, we combine an inclusive and friendly culture with a strong drive to achieve our high ambitions—because we know that success happens together. Here, you’ll work in a cross-functional environment, giving you the opportunity to make a real impact on both technology and product.  

  

Our customers are large enterprises with high demands on scalability, security, and quality—challenges that inspire our team and push us to grow. As a full-stack developer, you’ll be involved in the entire development journey, from idea to production, and take an active role in our structured product discovery process. Here, it’s not just about delivering—it’s about innovating and having fun along the way!

 *Check out our career page to get to know us more! ️**https://careers.mevisio.com*

### **What will you do?**


As a **Senior Fullstack Engineer with a Platform Focus**, you’ll be a key player in the evolution of Mevisio’s platform. Your work will be a mix of hands-on development and strategic improvements to our infrastructure, ensuring scalability, security, and performance. On a daily basis, you will:

**Drive our Infrastructure as Code strategy;** using Terraform and Kubernetes to automate deployments and ensure smooth operations in AWS.  

**Optimize platform performance;** refining event-driven and asynchronous processing using technologies like AMQP and Redis.  

**Contribute to secure high-quality code;** following Mevisio’s secure coding guidelines and peer-reviewing pull requests.  

**Monitor and enhance system reliability;** using observability tools to track real-time performance and proactively address potential issues.  

**Collaborate across teams and customers;** participating in planning, discovery, and retrospectives to ensure alignment between engineering, sales, and customer needs.  

**Develop and maintain core services in our microservice-based architecture;** focusing on scalability and resilience.

#### **Desired Technical Skills**

**Platform Engineering:** Proficiency in Infrastructure as Code practices, particularly using Terraform and Kubernetes in AWS environments. Familiarity with security best practices within these areas is a significant plus.

**Cloud:** Experience and interest in AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, and Terraform.  

**Language:** High proficiency in TypeScript and asynchronous programming.  

**Service Layer:** High proficiency in Node.js, including frameworks, with a strong understanding of core concepts such as event-driven architecture, the Node event loop, memory management, and asynchronous programming principles.  

**Data/Communication:** Experience of MongoDB, Redis, and AMQP.


##### **Other perks and benefits**


Centrally located office near public transit  

️ 30 paid holidays annually  

Attractive wellness contribution  

Pension plan  

Opportunities for professional development  

Flexible working hours and hybrid office setup  

Access to a nearby gym  

Regular social gatherings and team activities  

Centrally located office with modern amenities  

Latest tech gear  

️ Breakfast every day, coffee and tea  

  

**This is a great opportunity for you who want to use your expertise and yet get challenged from day to day! Come join us!**

 *Note: This is an internal recruitment by Mevisio. Therefore, we kindly ask external recruitment firms not to contact us!*

title: Senior Fullstack Engineer - Low-Code Compiler & Runtime
description:
**This is Mevisio**
-------------------


Mevisio is a powerful platform designed to elevate operational performance for leaders and teams, driving efficiency through smart visualization and enhanced communication. Our application transforms traditional whiteboards into interactive touch screens, displaying real-time KPIs and activities tailored to each client's needs. Trusted by global companies and digital leaders, Mevisio is deployed in over 3,000 facilities across 60+ countries, with more than half of our revenue coming from international markets.


Our customizable platform integrates seamlessly with other systems, supporting clients in diverse industries, particularly manufacturing and healthcare, where Lean principles thrive. By reducing waste and boosting safety and sustainability, Mevisio empowers organizations to achieve operational excellence and improve their overall performance.

### **Why Mevisio?**

At Mevisio, we combine an inclusive and friendly culture with a strong drive to achieve our high ambitions—because we know that success happens together. Here, you’ll work in a cross-functional environment, giving you the opportunity to make a real impact on both technology and product.  

  

Our customers are large enterprises with high demands on scalability, security, and quality—challenges that inspire our team and push us to grow. As a full-stack developer, you’ll be involved in the entire development journey, from idea to production, and take an active role in our structured product discovery process. As a **Senior Fullstack Engineer with a Compiler/Runtime Focus**, you’ll be a key player in the evolution of Mevisio’s platform. Your work will blend hands-on development with strategic improvements to our low-code language, runtime environment, and overall infrastructure—ensuring stability, performance, and a seamless developer experience. On a daily basis, you will:

* Develop and enhance our low-code language, refining the compiler and runtime for stability, predictability, and new functionality.
* Advance our Infrastructure as Code strategy, leveraging Terraform and Kubernetes for efficient, scalable AWS deployments.
* Optimize platform performance, improving event-driven and asynchronous processing with AMQP, Redis, and Node.js.
* Enhance system reliability, using observability tools to track performance, address bottlenecks, and improve resilience.
* Maintain core services in our microservice-based architecture, ensuring scalability and best practices with TypeScript, React, Node.js, and AWS.

#### **Desired Technical Skills**

**Programming Language & Compiler Design:** Experience in language design and compiler implementation (parsing, static analysis).  

**TypeScript & Asynchronous Programming:** Strong proficiency in TypeScript, including deep knowledge of async/await and other async patterns.  

**Frontend:** Extensive experience in React and its broader ecosystem.  

**Service Layer:** Solid understanding of Node.js frameworks, event-driven architecture, the Node event loop, memory management, and asynchronous programming principles.  

**Data/Communication:** Familiarity with MongoDB, Redis, and AMQP.  

**Cloud:** Experience and interest in AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, and Terraform.

title: IFS solution consultant
description:
**Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.**  

  

**YOUR ROLE**  

**We are seeking an IFS Application Consultant to join our fast-growing team.**  

  

**Capgemini has made a strategic decision to grow our IFS capacity in the Nordics. We do this in close collaboration with IFS and with a unique partnership. Our goal is to be the Nr 1 IFS Partner in Europe.**

**As a Solution Consultant, you will map customers’ business processes to business systems/applications, answer their queries, resolve issues, and offer advice in improving their solutions.**

**You will continuously develop yourself by acquiring new knowledge within the Capgemini targeted customer segments, in relevant or new IFS related functionality. You will share your knowledge with both customers and colleagues.**

**What we offer**

**In this role, you get a variety of work tasks and the possibility to gain knowledge in several areas. You will build a broad competence that is highly valued in many other teams - the career opportunities are many. You will be part of a highly engaged team who collaborates to solve complex support issues, you always get help from your teammates! Further developing your skills, you can access IFS Academy and get certified within your chosen areas.**

  

**YOUR PROFILE**  

**We are looking for people with a passion for technology, business processes and customer experiences. You also need to be able to communicate and collaborate with other people at various levels.**  



***To be successful in this role you need:***

* **Drive and a wish to learn new things**
* **Attention to details**
* **Excellent communication and cooperation skills**
* **Good ability to analyze and solve issues**
* **Deliver good service with the highest quality**
* **“Can do” attitude**

  

***Your skills:***

* **Degree, preferably or relevant professional qualifications**
* **Minimum of 3 years of experience in IFS Applications or similar business applications**
* **Solution-oriented mindset, with a passion for technology, business processes and customer support.**
* **Interest in interacting with customers and helping them find solutions as well as suggesting enhancements to improve their processes.**
* **Curiosity and eagerness to learn, a proactive approach and ability to adapt quickly to new processes and procedures.**
* **Fluency in Swedish and English, written and spoken.**
* **Knowledge of PL/SQL/REST will be an added advantage.**

**About Capgemini**

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating a tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion. Get The Future You Want |** **www.capgemini.com**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Senior ML Engineer
description:
- We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.


With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.


Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories

  
**Day-to-day life**

* Design, develop, and deploy cutting-edge machine learning models – crafting bespoke AI solutions for our Nordic clients.
* Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, and Google experts to overcome complex challenges and deliver impactful outcomes.
* Champion knowledge sharing and mentorship, guiding junior colleagues in the art of machine learning and fostering a culture of continuous learning.
* Stay at the forefront of Google Cloud AI/ML technologies, continuously expanding your expertise and exploring new possibilities.
* Confidently present solutions to clients, bridging the gap between complex algorithms and real-world business value, while actively cultivating and expanding those customer relationships.

Want to know more? Check out our people stories on Youtube


  
We're seeking a passionate and experienced ML Engineer with a proven track record in designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models. You'll be a cloud enthusiast with a deep understanding of AI/ML principles and hands-on experience with cloud technologies. As a coding expert, you'll possess strong Python skills and a solid foundation in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain, LangGraph).  



  

Excellent communication is essential – you'll build strong relationships with clients, translate their needs into innovative AI solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. You're a true collaborator, thriving in team environments where knowledge sharing and mutual support are paramount.
  

Fluency in both **Swedish** and **English** is required.


  
- **Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?**


	* Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
	* Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
	* Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
	* Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
	* End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
	* Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.*"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.*

We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn


**Benefits**


	* Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
	* Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
	* A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
	* An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
	* A human-centric and value-based company culture.
	* Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
	* A modern office in central Stockholm.
	* Full provision of work tools.
	* A variety of social events.Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.
  

  

Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page


Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior ML Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!


Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page
company_description: Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation.

title: BI-arkitekt till internationellt konsultbolag!
description:
*Hos Columbus ges du möjlighet att utveckla din kompetens och arbeta med teknik i framkant. Du arbetar i projektform med olika typer av kunder tillsammans med roliga och kompetenta kollegor!*


Som arkitekt på Data & AI arbetar du med utvecklare, projektledare och andra arkitekter. Din roll kommer att vara att driva lösningsarbetet, bygga effektiv arkitektur samt att planera projektets tekniska inriktning. Samtidigt rådger och vägleder du våra kunder kring plattformar som kan möta nya och föränderliga verksamhetskrav. Förutom dina kollegor inom Data & AI kommer du internt att träffa på kollegor från andra affärsområden på Columbus. På kundsidan kan du förvänta dig att arbeta nära kravställare, process- och systemägare.


För tillfället så utvecklar vi endast lösningar i Cloud (Azure). Vilket innebär att vi kan ligga i framkant med all applicerbar teknik som blommar upp, oavsett om det är AI eller annat.

*"**En typisk arbetsvecka för mig består av att driva våra kunders tekniska utveckling till att vara moderna och framtidssäkra, och samtidigt förvaltningsbara baserat på förvaltningsorganisationens kompetenser. Jag håller w**orkshops med kundernas tekniska organisation, domänarkitekter och product owners, samt nyckelpersoner på CXO/management nivå för att göra kravinsamling och coacha till förändring.* *Mitt arbete är även att coacha våra blivande talanger att utmana sig själva och utvecklas, revidera och utforma projektprocesser, hålla mig ajour med uppdateringar beträffande teknik och best practices."* *-* *Paul**, Lösningsarkitekt*

  

Du arbetar hos kund, på vårt kontor eller på ditt hemmakontor, på det sätt som du trivs bäst med. Du kommer alltid att tillhöra något av våra kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm eller Malmö.

**Varför Columbus?**
--------------------


Vi har i över 30 år levererat digitala lösningar till våra kunder och det har vi gjort framgångsrikt. Hur kommer det sig? Jo! På Columbus har vi en omfattande branschkunskap som kombineras med ett stort utbud av digitala lösningar och en rejäl dos kundförståelse. **Vi hjälper våra kunder att forma lösningar efter branschspecifika behov så att de kan nå sin fulla digitala potential.** Våra affärsområden kan dra nytta av varandra och arbeta med samma kunder i olika skeden av sin digitalisering och därmed erbjuda olika spetskompetenser.  

  



På Data & AI får du vara delaktig i ett område som är strategiskt viktigt för Columbus. Vi är en grupp på 50 konsulter i Skandinavien och vi växer!

  

*"Idag jobbar jag på en mer konceptuell nivå än i tidigare roller. Det är inte ovanligt att delta i strategi- och arkitekturmöten på ledningsgruppsnivå med kundverksamheten.* *På Columbus finns en stor kundflora – vilket ger en bred och intressant inblick i olika typer av projekt och kunder från olika branscher." - Paul, Lösningsarkitekt*  



**Du har med dig**
------------------


Vi söker dig med erfarenhet av att utforma, driva, motivera, presentera samt realisera lösningsarkitektur för BI-projekt med goda resultat. Du har en förmåga att hantera kundkontakt på olika nivåer, även C-level, och kan utifrån komplexa kravbilder kommunicera detta till en bred publik med varierande bakgrunder. Kommunikation är A och O i den här rollen och därför behöver du behärska både svenska och engelska.

  

* Du känner dig bekväm med Datawarehouse Architecture (Kimball / Inmon), ELT/ETL Architecture, BI Governance, Cloud Migration och Cloud Architecture (Azure).
* Har kunskap inom Azure Analysis Service, Power BI / Power BI Premium, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse och Azure SQL.

*Saknar du något av det som är nämnt i listan ovan? Tveka inte att söka ändå!* *Vi vill alltid knyta kontakt med duktiga BI-konsulter!*

**Ansökan**
-----------


Hos oss kan du ansöka med din LinkedIn eller CV och du behöver inte fylla i några långa frågeformulär. Rekryteringsprocessen kommer innebära en telefonintervju samt möten med chefer och medarbetare internt. Allt för att du, likväl som vi, ska känna att vi verkligen är en bra match. Har du några frågor om rollen så är du välkommen att kontakta Kristian Nilsson eller ansvarig rekryterare Daniel Sparrow.

**Mer om Columbus**
-------------------


Columbus är ett värdestyrt bolag med engagerade medarbetare som stöttar varandra i både framgång som motgång. Att ha en god balans mellan arbete och fritid är en självklarhet. Det kan vara allt från hämtning och lämning på förskola till väntan av det där paketet som ska levereras hem ”någon gång mellan 10-19”. Dessutom så är vi riktigt bra på att fira framgångar och det är inte ovanligt med fika, lyxfrukost och AW på kontoret. På Columbus har vi även trevliga förmåner för att stötta våra medarbetare i livets olika stadier.

  

Spana in vårt Insta-flöde för att få en bild av **hur det är att jobba hos oss** genom våra kollegor. Klicka på bilden för att komma till Instagram-kontot.

***Helt ofiltrerat*** *har vi samlat in omdömen från nuvarande och tidigare kollegor. Klicka nedan för att läsa mer.*
company_description: We are the #1 one partner in the Nordics when it comes to digital transformation. We help our customers with solutions according to industry-specific needs to reach their full potential.

title: System Engineer, Enterprise (Stockholm)
company_industry: Computer Hardware Manufacturing and Software Development
description:
**BE PART OF BUILDING THE FUTURE.**
 What do NASA and emerging space companies have in common with COVID vaccine R&D teams or with Roblox and the Metaverse?
   

  

 The answer is data, -- all fast moving, fast growing industries rely on data for a competitive edge in their industries. And the most advanced companies are realizing the full data advantage by partnering with Pure Storage. Pure’s vision is to redefine the storage experience and empower innovators by simplifying how people consume and interact with data. With 11,000+ customers including 58% of the Fortune 500, we’ve only scratched the surface of our ambitions.
   

  

**Pure Is Blazing Trails And Setting Records**
* For ten straight years, Gartner has named Pure a leader in the Magic Quadrant
* Our customer-first culture and unwavering commitment to innovation have earned us a certified Net Promoter Score in the top 1% of B2B companies globally
* Industry analysts and press applaud Pure’s leadership across these dimensions
* And, our 5,000+ employees are emboldened to make Pure a faster, stronger, smarter company as we go


 If you, like us, say “bring it on” to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.
   

  

**SHOULD YOU ACCEPT THIS CHALLENGE...**
**In This Role, You'll**
* Develop an exhaustive understanding of what drives a customer’s business and what motivates their decision making
* Passionately bring to light the advantages of a Pure Storage solution
* Refine sales strategy and tactics, taking command of technical responsibilities
* Delight customers and teammates with your technical leadership and domain expertise on storage products, distributed storage architectures, file systems, and competitive storage offerings in the DAS, NAS and SAN product spaces
* Take control of evaluations and benchmarks, system configurations, and system installations
* Build and deliver technical product and architecture presentations with vigor to customers and lock in the technical win with clients and prospective accounts
* Capture requirements and translate Customer’s business needs into innovative solutions to accelerate their growth and capacity
* Author responses to RFI & RFPs
* Seek out and spur new opportunities for interoperability, functional, and performance testing/validation
* Promote mutual roadmap and planning exchanges
* Liaise with product and technical marketing to produce materials (i.e. whitepaper, web presentations) that support overall alliance plans and objectives
* Stay current with the competition and ensure that materials accurately reflect the latest, differentiated solution positioning
* Move with market trends and competitive landscape to promote thought leadership within our organization


**What You’ll Need To Bring To This Role...**
* Fluent English and Swedish language skills
* Pre-sales experience is required
* 5+ years minimum experience supporting the sales of enterprise storage, networking or systems solutions to a combination of large enterprise accounts and data centers
* Deep understanding of the architecture, design and implementation of multi-tiered client/server and web-based computing solutions
* Prior experience in targeting new prospects and converting them into clients
* Contribute significant portions and/or lead responses to RFPs, RFQs and RFIs
* Superior knowledge of current and emerging storage architectures (FC, iSCSI, NAS, OSD, SAN)
* UNIX OS, NFS file systems and UNIX distributed network environment
* Installation/configuration of distributed computing, multiprocessing, virtual memory subsystem, storage subsystems architecture, shared memory architectures, cache architectures, windowing systems
* Strong knowledge of digital transformation to a Cloud Native architecture, On-Prem, Public Cloud, Provisioning Automation, and Containers
* Knowledge of VMWare, Local Area Networking, Ethernet, TCP/IP and general networking
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* BS in CS, EE or other technical degree and/or equivalent experience
* Familiarity with modern web architecture a plus (LAMP stack, scale-out vs scale-up architectures, NoSQL alternatives)
* Application knowledge is highly desirable


*And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources, and company-sponsored team events - check out purebenefits.com for more information.*
**BE YOU—CORPORATE CLONES NEED NOT APPLY.**
 Pure is where you ask big questions, think differently, and make an impact. This is not just a job, but a place where you have a voice and can accelerate your career. We value unique thoughts and celebrate individuality, and with ample opportunity to learn, develop yourself, and expand into different roles, joining Pure is an investment in your career journey.
   

  

 Through our Pure Equality program, which supports a flourishing field of employee resource groups, we nourish the personal and professional lives of our team members. And our Pure Good Foundation gives back to local and global communities through volunteering and grants.
   

  

 And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources, and company-sponsored team events.
   

  

**PURE IS COMMITTED TO EQUALITY.**
 Research shows that in order to apply for a job, women feel they need to meet 100% of the criteria while men usually apply after meeting about 60%. Regardless of how you identify, if you believe you can do the job and are a good match, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

 Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire.
   

  

 If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at
 **TA-Ops@purestorage.com** 
 .
   

  

**APPLICANT & CANDIDATE PERSONAL INFORMATION PRIVACY NOTICE.**
 If you're wondering how or why Pure collects or uses information you provide, we invite you to check out our Applicant & Candidate Personal Information Protection Notice.
   

  

**DEEMED EXPORT LICENSE NOTICE.**
 Some positions may require a deemed export license for compliance with applicable laws and regulations. Please note: Pure does not currently sponsor deemed export license applications so we are unable to proceed with applicants requiring stated sponsorship.

title: Azure Virtual Desktop/Citrix Specialist
description:
Xenit's goal is not only to become Sweden's leading cloud partner, but to be Sweden's kindest cloud partner.
   

  

 Our theory is that satisfied workers produce satisfying work, and so we aim to create a working environment in which our employees can thrive - working independently, flexibly and happily.
   

  

 We are happy with hybrid remote working, encourage collaboration between offices and freedom in choosing devices/equipment & working hours.
   

  

 Why not find out more about us?
   

  

**A Z U R E V I R T U A L D E S K T O P / C I T R I X S P E C I A L I S T
   

  

 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_**
 Full-time | Permanent | Team Workspace
   

  

**A B O U T X E N I T**
 Xenit is a growth company which specializes in Cloud and Modern Work. Our committed employees inspire, challenge and encourage each other, while providing extensive value for our customers. Xenit is
 **Microsoft's Partner of the Year, Sweden** 
 for 2024, illustrating our commitment to technical development, being on the cutting edge of tech, and our close partnership with Microsoft.
   

  

*Fun fact: Team Manager, Victor Nasslander, was voted Xenit's favourite manager for 2024*
**W H A T W E N E E D**
 We are currently looking for a specialist within
 **Azure Virtual Desktop/Citrix/NetScaler** 
 - any or all of the fun virtualization technologies!
   

  

 At Xenit, we have two teams who typically look for Cloud based competence: Our Cloud Infrastructure Team, and our Workspace team. The Workspace team is responsible for managing the
 **Xenit Azure Virtual Desktop feature service** 
 , which you will have the opportunity to continuously develop and improve, as well as implementing solutions for our customers. Like most people with sense, we hate carrying out the same task time and time again, so you will make sure to streamline and automate anything that
 *can* 
 be automated.
   

  

**Examples Of Potential Tasks**
* Managing customers' AVD environments (including incident management, change management and developing environments).
* Participating in projects with a focus on implementation and set up of Virtual Workspace solutions
* Acting as a general Azure resource in other consulting assignments (dependent on level of Azure expertise)


**C O U L D Y O U B E A M A T C H ?**
**We Believe Our Next AVD/Citrix Specialist Has**
* Preferably 2/3+ years of experience within Microsoft Azure; preferably Azure Virtual Desktop, perhaps Azure Compute, Virtualization & Scalability
* Experience with cloud migration, transition or transformation projects
* Experience with Citrix or other virtual environments
* General skills within Infrastructure: Windows Server, Linux, Networking, Security


**It Is a Bonus If You Have**
* Skills within Automation
* Relevant certifications/education


 We aren't looking for the most senior person in the world, but we do want to see a good background within infrastructure, some proven experience within Cloud (Azure, AVD if possible), a consultant personality/attitude and a passion for technology
   

  

 Right: Expert Engineer, Hanessa and left: Team Manager, Victor Nasslander
   

  

**We Also Believe That You Are a Person Who**
* Acts on their own initiative, makes things happen and takes responsibility for their own work/successes/failures.
* Has their head in the clouds - a "cloud first" approach ☁️
* Is hungry to be better and to excel within their career
* Fluent in spoken and written Swedish and English
* Above all else, displays kindness and compassion in everything they do


**W H Y C H O O S E X E N I T ?**
**Benefits**
 Xenit boasts a large benefits package, read full list here.
   

  

**Super interesting colleagues**
 With us you will find spinning instructors, parkour practitioners, gamers, art historians, rugby players, puzzle maniacs, film geeks and much more.
   

  

 With us, you are free to be who you are. Our workforce is so diverse, that one of the only things each person has in common is an incredible drive and passion for what they do.
   

  

**Activities ⛹**
 Each quarter, we host
 **Xenit Inspire** 
 where employees are able to share specialist knowledge, information about cool projects, and take part in tasks centered around innovation - workshops and hackathons. We also offer annual conferences, team building, after works, and "Bring a Buddy" lunches at the office.
   

  

 Last year, Xenit was awarded
 **"Career Company of 2024"** 
 . This prestigious recognition underscores our commitment to fostering a workplace culture that values inclusivity, well-being, and growth.
   

  

*"Xenit is an outstanding employer where corporate culture and well-being are at the center. Here, the employees are part of a warm and inclusive community where their well-being and well-being are prioritized. By offering an environment where collaboration, creativity and innovation are encouraged, employees can thrive and develop while contributing to the company's success."*

title: SMB Sales Specialist
description:
**Company Description**
 Devoteam is a leading technology partner to Google Cloud, AWS, and Microsoft across EMEA. With 20+ years of successful Google Cloud implementations and a team of certified experts, we drive digital transformation across various industries.
   

  

 At Devoteam, we champion a revolutionary "New Way of Work" that prioritises flexibility, personal growth, and joint success.
   

  

  
   

  

  

**Job Description**
 Drive Digital Transformation: Become a Mid-Market Cloud Advisor
   

* As a Cloud Advisor for Google Cloud and other cloud technologies at Devoteam, you will play a crucial role in expanding our footprint across the Nordics and DACH. You will be responsible for:
* Hunting for New Business: Identify and acquire new customers with a focus on medium-sized businesses, generating leads and building strong relationships with key decision-makers.
* Driving Revenue Growth: Develop and execute sales strategies to achieve ambitious targets, exceeding customer expectations and contributing to Devoteam's continued success with hyperscalers and ISVs.
* Mastering the Sales Cycle: Own the entire sales process, from initial contact and needs analysis to proposal development, negotiation, and closing deals.
* Building Long-Term Partnerships: Cultivate strong relationships with existing clients, identifying opportunities to expand our services and ensure their ongoing success in all areas of their technology procurement.


 Staying Ahead of the Curve: Maintain a deep understanding of the evolving Cloud ecosystem, including new products, services, and market trends.
   

  

  
   

  

 Success Stories:
   

  

*"Joining Devoteam in the Nordics has been a transformative experience. The support from the local tech teams and the clear growth path have enabled me to consistently exceed my sales targets."
   

  

 — Aliha Mahmood, Junior Sales, Sweden*
*"Transitioning from Google to Devoteam has been a remarkable experience. The collaborative culture and unwavering commitment to innovation at Devoteam have empowered me to utilize my Google Cloud expertise to its fullest potential. Working with cutting-edge Google Cloud solutions here has significantly advanced my career and allowed me to deliver exceptional value to our clients."
   

  

 — Thomas Brunn, Sales Executive, Norway*
 Territory
   

* You'll be working with startups and mid-market corporations across the Nordic or the DACH region, primarily digital natives.


  

  

**Qualifications**
* Proven Hunter: Demonstrated success in acquiring new customers and closing deals in the IT project business, with a focus on hyperscaler technologies.
* Solution-Oriented Mindset: Ability to understand client challenges and translate them into effective Cloud solutions.
* Strong Communication & Presentation Skills: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively articulate the value proposition of Cloud to C-level executives.
* Relationship Builder: A natural networker who can build rapport and establish trust with clients and internal stakeholders.
* Results-Driven: Highly motivated and results-oriented, with a strong work ethic and a commitment to exceeding expectations.
* Languages: Excellent written and spoken English skills are essential. Fluency in a Nordic language is a plus. In DACH fluent German is a requirement.


        
   

  

  

**Additional Information**
 Devoteam is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. We encourage applications from individuals with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
   

  

  

  

 Benefits:
   

* Flexible Work Arrangements: Enjoy a hybrid work model with the freedom to choose your working hours and location.
* Career Development: Access to the Devoteam Academy for certified training and language courses, supporting your professional growth.
* International Opportunities: Explore potential career opportunities within our global network.
* Vibrant Culture: Be part of a dynamic and supportive team with regular social events and team-building activities.

title: Mjukvaruarkitekt - Castra
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!*
**Rollen**
 Som Mjukvaruarkitekt kommer du att inneha en central roll i att definiera och skapa övergripande tekniska lösningar för komplexa mjukvaruprojekt. Du kommer att säkerställa att tekniska lösningar stödjer företagets mål och att systemarkitekturen är stabil, skalbar och säker.
   

  

**Erfarenhet**
 Du har en stark bakgrund inom mjukvaruutveckling samt arkitekturarbete i agila utvecklingsprocesser och har fördelaktigt moderniserat mjukvarulösningar förr.
   

  

 Vi ser även att du har:
   

  

* Bakgrund inom utveckling med erfarenhet av exempelvis Java, Python samt diverse ramverk
* Förmåga att förstå och översätta företagets strategiska mål till tekniska krav och lösningar.
* Design av systemarkitekturer med hänsyn till skalbarhet, prestanda och säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av molnbaserad arkitektur och tjänster som AWS, Azure och/eller Google Cloud.
* Kunskap kring Docker och Kubernetes
* Förståelse för säkerhetsaspekter inom mjukvaruarkitektur och datahantering


 Låter detta som du i det stora hela? Hör av dig, så tar vi upp dialogen redan under kommande vecka!
   

  

**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Här tror vi på frihet, möjligheter och medbestämmande. Att du som medarbetare ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas och forma ditt arbete utefter dina intressen och prioriteringar i livet. Att alla får vara med och forma och påverka bolaget genom delägarskap, advisory board och projektgrupper. Att det är viktigt att ha ett sammanhang, känna tillhörighet och att man har kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och tror på en.
   

  

**Om Castra**
 Castra är en entreprenörsdriven konsultgrupp inom IT, management och systemutveckling. Bolaget ägs gemensamt av medarbetarna och tillsammans bygger vi det företag vi själva vill jobba på.
   

  

 Vår vision är att vi ska vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för konsulter. Att vi blivit certifierade av Great Place to Work® fem år i rad är ett bevis på våra höga mål kring företagskultur. Våra tankar om delaktighet, påverkansmöjligheter och respekt för individens egna val och möjligheter fungerar.
   

  

 Företaget har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Sundsvall, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida www.castra.se.
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 
 Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta Charlotta.Ljung@castra.se Tfn: 072-871 63 12

title: Azure Specialist
description:
Är du en passionerad Azure utvecklare som vill vara i framkant av teknologins innovation? Vi söker dig som vill arbeta med de senaste teknikerna och banbrytande projekt - Bli en del av vårt dynamiska team och forma framtidens lösningar!
   

  

 Vårt Microsoft Cloud Apps Team i Stockholm växer och vi letar efter dig som brinner för arbete inom Azure! Vårt kontor ligger centralt i Stockholm med fantastisk utsikt över kanalen, precis vid Barnhusbron. Microsoft Cloud Apps teamet är ett medelstort team på ca 20 personer utspridda på ett antal olika uppdrag. De flesta kör en kombination av hemarbete, arbete hos kund och arbete på Capgemini kontoret. Ett uppskattat inslag när vi umgås tillsammans i teamet är gemensam fredagsfika, regelbundna teammöten och gemensamma aktiviteter. Vår vision är att vara ett team som arbetar brett med kompetens att leverera end to end-lösningar till våra kunder.
   

  

**OM ROLLEN**
 Som Azure Specialist med expertkompetens inom Microsoft Azure Cloud hos oss på Capgemini kommer du att vara en del av ett högpresterande och agilt utvecklingsteam som arbetar med affärskritiska lösningar och teamleveranser för våra kunder. Vi använder de mest avancerade tekniska lösningarna och tjänsterna från Microsoft och andra ledande partners, vilket säkerställer att du utvecklar en framtidssäkrad kompetens och undviker att fastna i utdaterade teknologier.
   

  

 Hos oss får du arbeta i framkant med testdriven utveckling, AI och clean code. Du kommer att ha ett stort eget ansvar och delta i alla utvecklingsfaser, från kravanalys och design till utveckling, test och leverans. Tillsammans med dina kollegor hjälper du våra kunder att digitalt transformera och modernisera sina verksamheter. Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, certifieringar och spännande kunduppdrag för att stödja din karriärutveckling. Vårt mål är att du ska bli en framstående multi-domän specialist inom Microsoft Azure Cloud.
   

  

**DIN PROFIL**
 Under din tid hos oss kommer du få stora möjligheter att utvecklas och lära dig massor men vi ser att du besitter:
   

  

* Som grund minst fem års erfarenhet inom Azure Microsoft Cloud
* Du har en utvecklarbakgrund inom Microsoft .Net och är duktig på DevOps
* Erfarenhet av containerbaserad utveckling så som Kuberneters, Microservices
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska då båda språken används i det dagliga arbetet
* Erfarenhet inom något eller flera Microsoft Azure områden så som Azure Integrations, Azure Native Development, Azure Governance/Cloud Adoption, Azure App Modernization eller Azure Big Data AI/ML


*Meriterande*
* Fördelaktigt om du har erfarenhet av Optimizely


**VAD VI TROR KOMMER FÅ DIG ATT TRIVAS**
* Föräldraförmån
* Flexibla arbetsförhållanden & Work-from-Home Policy
* Tech communities
* Mentorskapsprogram (som mentor eller mentee)
* Delaktighet i Capgeminis olika fokusområden; Diversity and Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness club, Art club etc.
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag & tjänstepension
* Möjlighet till bonusprogram
* Kompetensutveckling i form av utbildningar och certifieringar
* Roliga och inspirerande personalevent
* Företagshälsovård & sjukvårdsförsäkring


**ANSÖKAN**
 Vi arbetar med löpande urval så vänta inte - skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Vi ser framemot din ansökan och att du vill bli en del av vår fortsatta resa!
   

  

**OM CAPGEMINI**
 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda deras övergång till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2023 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,5 miljarder euro.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Growth Engineer
description:
We want a data-obsessed engineer to decode how our customers use Lovable and turn those insights into explosive growth. You'll create automated systems that predict user behavior, find magic moments, and tell us what to build next. Must combine serious coding skills with the ability to turn complex data into winning product bets (and help implement them).
 



  





**Why Lovable?** 




  




* **Change the world, literally:** 
 2025 is the year AI works, and Lovable has the best AI full stack engineer product (According to industry veterans)
* **Work, learn, have fun:** 
 We're building the strongest technical team in Europe. You will shape our culture and be inspired in a place of exceptional talent density
* **Build a unique network:** 
 Lovable is a global top AI brand that the world is eager to work with. You will meet and work with some of the most important people in tech
* **Get autonomy & ownership:** 
 With lots of things being built, this is a unique opportunity to get ownership and have a true impact on our product
* **Compensation:** 
 Lovable pays top of market cash and equity, and is committed to compensate better than any other company in Sweden on a performance basis



  





**What we're looking for:** 




  




* A builder who thinks in systems and code, not just SQL queries and dashboards
* Supernatural ability to spot patterns in messy data and turn them into actionable insights
* Obsession with understanding why users do what they do
* Strong opinions about what metrics actually matter
* Passion for using AI to automate analysis and surface insights



  





**Your responsibilities:** 




  




* Own our north star metrics and make them go up and to the right
* Find "aha moments" that turn users into paying customers & shape our dev roadmap
* Build automated systems that tell us when something is wrong before our users do
* Own our dashboards and tools and use them to make all of us data-driven
* Build and run a killer A/B testing program for product & marketing initiatives



  





**Our tech stack:** 




  





 We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:
 



  




* Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces
* Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance
* Cloud: Cloudflare, Fly.io, Google Cloud Run, AWS, Terraform
* And always exploring what's next



  





**How applying works:** 




  




1. Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.
2. We'll send you a quick take-home for (1) a written case study and (2) a loom video presentation
3. If possible, join us for a week of (paid) trial work. We'll see you working in-person and you get to meet the team & explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you



  





**About Your Application:** 




  




* Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join
* We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system
* We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs

title: Solutions Engineer Europe
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About Energy Systems**
 We help customers navigate the complex transition to a decarbonized and more sustainable energy future. We do this by assuring that energy systems work safely and effectively, using solutions that are increasingly digital. We also help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry.
   

  

**About The Role**
 DNV Energy Systems is looking for a Solutions Engineer based in Northern Europe to support the Smart Cable Guard (SCG) Unit within DNV.
   

  

 Smart Cable Guard (SCG) is an online multi-functional monitoring system for MV power cable networks. The system has two unique functions: detect and locate weak spots and detect and locate faults in underground power cables. The automated system immediately gives a warning when problems arise.
   

  

 You will get the opportunity to be part of the Global SCG team, and together with other colleagues you will help sell and implement SCG systems and services, bridging the gap between SCG’s technical offering and the customer’s needs in Europe.
   

  

 The overall purpose of the job is to support the Smart Cable Guard Unit in its role to help DNV safeguard life, property and the environment and achieve our company vision: To be a
 **trusted voice to tackle global transformations.**
 As a Solutions Engineer, you will drive business growth by understanding customer pain points and requirements, SCG’s application, and articulating the value of SCG’s system. Adept at explaining complex technical concepts in a simple manner, you’ll support sales by developing and presenting product solutions and work alongside sales teams throughout the sales journey. You will be expected to visit prospects and existing customers on a regular basis. As a result of this you will be expected to travel between 25% and 50% of your time.
   

  

 As a Solutions Engineer for DNV Smart Cable Guard, you will have these main roles and responsibilities:
   

  

* Support SCG sales managers with prospecting and qualifying opportunities in Europe, matching customer requirements to proposed solutions, building financial and technical business cases, closing deals and project kick-off transitions
* Provide technical expertise during the sales cycle, emphasizing SCG’s benefits and competitive advantages
* Lead SCG demonstrations highlighting relevant features and functions and addressing questions about the system and its application(s)
* Help develop and execute Proof of Concepts to demonstrate the feasibility and effectiveness of SCG’s system
* Study customer needs, pain points and business challenges and create proposals with the sales teams
* Interact with the engineering or technical teams to address technical concerns or requirements
* Collaborate with internal teams to gather technical requirements and ensure the successful implementation of SCG’s system
* Give active feedback and insights from the market to the product development and marketing team as well as consult on product development, providing voice of the customer input
* Secure orders, guarantee product standards and assure product delivery, working collaboratively with sales, product and operations teams
* Establish and maintain customer rapport
* Give technical input on sales plans, contracts and standards reviews, and pricing strategies sales
* Collaborate and create SCG documentation, such as catalogues, manuals, specification sheets, demonstration tutorials, and training
* Work closely with marketing on sales enablement and lead generation, playing a crucial role demonstrating the value proposition in the market, including at 2-3 events per year


 What we offer
   

  

 Our benefits package is specifically designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being.
   

  

* Get secured for the future with our pension scheme, profit share, health care and wellness benefits
* Enjoy the flexibility to handle your work in a way that suits you and your lifestyle
* Work with some of the most engaging and competent colleagues in the industry
* Receive guidance from colleagues around the globe through coaching, mentoring and networks
* Advance your skills and expertise, through individual development plans and tailored training
* Develop your managerial skills, by going through our state-of-the-art leadership programs
* Be part of a world renowned and growing organization with origins dating back to 1864


 DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.
   

  

**About You**
 What is Required
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in related discipline or equivalent professional experience
* Understanding of the energy industry and a strong technical background to be able to communicate SCG’s system to both technical and non-technical resources in the industry
* Proven ability in presenting products and services to energy clients and fielding customer queries
* Excellent people skills to collaborate with internal teams, manage customer expectations, and ensure customer satisfaction at all stages of the process
* Strong problem solving and analytical skills, with ability to identify customer needs and propose innovative solutions
* Self-motivated and target driven with a proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets and driving revenue growth
* Informed on trends in the industry, competition, and market direction
* Willingness to travel within the region and limited internationally


**What Is Preferred**
* 2+ years of Solutions Engineer experience or similar role
* Ability to demonstrate the SCG system, with confidence in the product, at customer meetings and events
* Experience working in the DSO/Utility space
* Skilled at using customer relationship management (CRM) software such as Sales Force for opportunity tracking and reporting of a pipeline
* Start-up mindset with capacity to collaborate with product development, operations, and marketing to advance SCG growth
* Experience working with cross functional teams, including product development, marketing, and operations
* Demonstrate technical expertise, strong communication and presentation skills

title: Chief Information Security Officer (CISO)
description:
What we do at Qliro
   

  

 At Qliro, we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly, and highly competent people who together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be. We are now on a journey of scaling our business both in Sweden and across the Nordics.
   

  

 What your team does
   

  

 As our Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), you will lead the Information Security and Risk Management (ISRM) team. Our mission is to protect Qliro’s assets while ensuring compliance with all legal requirements related to information security, risk management, and privacy. We operate in a fast-moving, agile environment and work closely with teams across Tech, Legal, Risk, Compliance, and the broader organization to continuously enhance our security posture.
   

  

 What you’ll do
   

  

* Manage and coordinate the ISRM team and oversee Qliro’s information security strategy.
* Develop and maintain documentation, processes, and risk management frameworks for InfoSec governance.
* Lead Business Continuity Management, including impact assessments, continuity planning, and disaster recovery.
* Drive education and awareness programs to ensure security and privacy understanding at all levels, from employees to the Board.
* Oversee third-party risk management, including vendor onboarding and annual reviews.
* Act as the main contact for internal and external auditors and facilitate compliance with PCI DSS and GDPR.
* Assess security maturity and report to relevant stakeholders, including Board and executive management.
* Serve as an InfoSec stakeholder in various strategic initiatives, including cloud migration, vendor management, and privacy compliance.
* Lead the InfoSec committee and Privacy Forum, coordinating cross-functional security initiatives.
* Ensure implementation of technical and organizational privacy controls in compliance with GDPR.
* Manage Qliro’s physical security processes, including security systems and vendor contracts.
* Monitor cybersecurity maturity, facilitate implementation of best practices, and drive continuous improvements.
* Oversee Qliro’s cyber incident response, ensuring preparedness and swift action when necessary.


 What you bring to the team
   

  

* 3-5 years of experience leading an InfoSec team or holding a senior InfoSec role (CISO or Head of InfoSec).
* Experience in the finance industry, preferably in a regulated environment.
* Strong knowledge of information security frameworks and certifications such as ISO27001, PCI DSS, CISA, or CISSP.
* A background in technology, such as IT auditing, development or IT operations, is highly beneficial.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey security concepts across all levels of the organization.
* Experience implementing security controls in cloud environments is a plus.
* A strategic mindset combined with a hands-on approach to problem-solving.


 WOW in everything we do
   

  

 We work hard to create a workplace that is diverse and inclusive, with employees from over 30 countries worldwide. We believe in the power of collaboration and empowering each other, and we strive to create a WOW experience in everything we do. Our future way of working is hybrid, combining time in the office with remote work. We see our office as a space for collaboration and creativity, where we bring out the best in one another.
   

  

 Does this sound like your next challenge? Apply now and join us on our journey!

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Company Description** 




 Nova by Bizware specializes in helping organizations evolve, streamline, and manage their decision support systems, data warehouses, and BI-Solutions. We work with several clients in Stockholm within various industries.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 This is a full-time on-site role for a Data Engineer located in Stockholm. The Data Engineer will be responsible for data engineering, data modeling, ETL processes, data warehousing, and data analytics on a day-to-day basis.
 



  





**Qualifications** 



* Data Engineering and Data Modeling skills
* Experience with ETL/ELT/pipeline processes
* Strong Data Warehousing and Data Analytics skills
* Excellent proficiency in SQL, python and similar data manipulation languages
* Experience with cloud platforms like Azure, Databricks or Snowflake
* Fluency in Swedish (spoken and written) is a requirement
* A minimum 2,5 years experience from projects is required
* At least bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field

title: Data Scientist
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
**Join us in our mission to provide exceptional statistical support and drive the future of Scania's quality solutions.**
 Welcome to the Quality Information team within the SCANIA Brand Identity Development Field Quality organization!
   

  

 We're on a mission to provide top-notch statistical support for decisions and analysis that describe the quality situation in the field. Our team is transitioning from physical servers to the cloud as part of Scania's "cloud first" strategy, using Azure and Snowflake. We gather data from various sources, including vehicle production, warranty information, fault codes, workshop work orders, and operational data. We visualize this information using Power BI and SAS VIYA. With one of our analysts moving to a new position within Scania, we're on the lookout for a new team member to join our dynamic and innovative group.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Build and modify Power BI reports, perform advanced analysis, and create data models related to our customer vehicles. This includes operational data, fault codes, failures, repair history, and software updates.
* Dive into the exciting world of machine learning to uncover new insights and benefits in our data.
* Work closely with a team of analysts and data engineers in Södertälje and Brazil, all striving towards the same goal – helping our customers make data-driven decisions.
* Actively participate in management team meetings and be responsible for yearly planning, coordination, and follow-ups.


**Who You Are**
 We're looking for someone who thrives in a transforming organization.
   

  

 You have a degree in engineering, computer science, or a similar field, and you possess excellent analytical skills. You enjoy helping others and have a knack for SQL coding and building reports in Power BI or SAS Viya. Experience in these platforms is a plus. As an analyst/data scientist in our team, you need to be communicative, as you'll regularly interact with both the business side and Scania IT. You're ambitious, well-structured, and thrive in both team and individual settings.
   

  

 You have excellent problem-solving skills and a curiosity about the automotive industry.
   

  

**Skills We Value:**
* Statistical Analysis.
* DAX Programming.
* SQL Server & SSAS.
* Building Reports in Power BI.
* Python or R Programming.


**This Is Us**
 Quality Information is a team within the SCANIA Brand Identity Development Field Quality organization that provides statistical support for decisions and analysis needed to describe the quality situation in the field. Our team is currently moving all our data to the cloud as part of Scania's "cloud first" strategy, using Azure and Snowflake. We collect data from various sources, including information about our produced vehicles, warranty information, fault codes, workshop work orders, and operational data. We visualize this information in Power BI or SAS VIYA.
   

  

 Our team consists of three analysts and three data engineers in Södertälje and two analysts in Brazil. Since one of our analysts has moved to another position within Scania, we are looking for their replacement. Join us and be part of a team that values creativity, collaboration, and a customer-centric approach. Together, we help our customers make data-driven decisions with a smile and big hearts!
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-03-16. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact me Helena Blomqvist, Head of Quality Information, +46 8 553 89 127, helena.blomqvist@scania.com, or Jan Lindeborg, Senior Analyst, jan.lindeborg@scania.com or my colleague Patrik Neckman who is in charge of the recruitment process itself: +46 737 269 409, patrik.neckman@scania.com.
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**
*In this recruitment, we are looking internally at R&D due to the ongoing business transition*

title: Engineering Manager to SEB Life & Pension I Stockholm
description:
*Since SEB was founded in 1856, our focus on customers and long-term relationships has been at the heart of our success. We aim to drive positive change by providing capital to help everyone reach their goals and accelerate progress towards a sustainable tomorrow.*
 Life & Pension in SEB is one of the largest pensions and insurance provider in Sweden and we serve both corporate and private customers. Our offering consists of products and services for important life events and by this we create certainty in an uncertain future. As a subsidiary in a large financial service group, we are able to benefit from a small company’s advantages that give you as an employee the possibility to influence and at the same time get access to a large company’s possibilities to develop and grow.
   

  

**About the role:**
 We are now looking for an Engineering Manager for our IT area, Data & Analytics, part of the Financial Management and Data Analytic Tribe (FMDA). FMDA is responsible for developing and managing solutions related to analytics, regulatory and financial reporting. This area is the main contributor and driver of the Life & Pensions AI and cloud initiatives.
   

  

 The Data and Analytic area consists of 12 employees and consultants working with our data warehouses and analytical platform for insurance and financial data. As an engineering manager, you are a part of the IT Management Team that are responsible for the entire system landscape within SEB Life & Pension.
   

  

**As an Engineering Manager you will be responsible for:**
* Driving the software development and Life Cycle Management forward together with your employees and colleagues cross-functional
* Securing stable operation of the maintained solutions
* Capacity and delivery planning for the teams, ensuring that the right competencies and skills are in place.
* Be one of the drivers of the AI-journey within Life & Pension
* Driving Reliable and Optimized operation within the domain
* Collaborate with Product Owners and business representatives to secure the correct focus and scope of the team’s work.
* Driving change initiatives as part of the business plan and promote a culture of high performance and continuous improvement.
* Take responsibility for the IT-contracts relevant to your area, with support from legal and vendor management.


**To thrive in this role, we believe you:**
* Have a couple of year's managerial experience, within the tech area leading developers and other technical specialist.
* Have a technical background with experience from machine learning, generative AI and cloud
* Have a good knowledge of the ITIL-processes
* Have experience from change management, contract management, budgeting and planning.
* Have strong communication skills and you are fluent in both Swedish and English.
* Academic background within Computer Science, Data, engineering or equivalent
* Beneficial with experience from life and insurance products


**What we offer:**
* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* International opportunities and working environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


**Welcome with your application**
 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 9th of March 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Head of IT Lena Schaumann at lena.schaumann @seb.se or Sebastian Vesterlund, sebastian.vesterlund @seb.se
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB here:** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Security Engineer
description:
*You know that corporate document or piece of research you know you have somewhere but you can’t seem to find it?* 
 🤯
 *The struggle to gather, organize and visualize all corporate knowledge and insights is real.*
****We are Stravito and this is the problem we solve.****
 Due to the universal nature of this problem, our customers come from various industries all around the world. We help world-leading organizations, such as McDonald’s, AT&T, Burberry and Heineken, get closer to their customers and make better, insights-backed decisions by organizing their knowledge and making it easy to access through our intuitive platform.
   

  

 We really mean it when we say we're a diverse and international team as our team of 100 has more than 30 different nationalities! We are guided by our operating principles: simplicity first, an “own it, do it” mentality, embracing different perspectives, and enjoying the journey together.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As our first dedicated Security Engineer, you'll play a key role in ensuring the security of our platform. You will join a tech team with a great team environment and high quality standards, to go from good to great when it comes to security related topics. You will nurture a robust internal security community, evolving our bug bounty program, setting security standards for our production pipeline, and defining security measures for our GenAI features.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities Will Include**
* Finding and fixing code vulnerabilities
* Testing and improving security in our AI pipelines
* Support other engineers in secure coding practices
* Lead and mentor our Security functional group
* Manage our bug bounty program.


****About you****
 To succeed in this role you will need a solid understanding of software architecture and security, including compliance and regulations. We believe you have experience from back-end development, preferably in Java/Kotlin from working in a product company. You have extensive knowledge in AWS-specific security measures, as well as OWASP or similar frameworks. Certifications such as CSSLP or OSCP is a plus, as well as experience working with Python and TypeScript. With strong communication skills and a helpful approach, you effectively collaborate with a variety of stakeholders and team members. You have the ability to prioritize and advise in all things Security, both internally at Stravito and to our customers.
   

  

****What’s in it for you?****
 You will join a remote-first and globally spread team, with company events a couple of times each year as the icing on the cake 🎂 We offer a fun, collaborative environment where everyone truly cares and helps each other. We have zero micro-management and instead you are encouraged to cultivate your own processes while giving and receiving feedback for improvement. Add to that a competitive compensation package, the possibility of working with cutting-edge technology in our industry (such as GenAI) and to be part of simplifying the professional lives of many - what’s not to like?
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Data Modeller to bank!
description:
**About the position** 




 Perido is looking for a skilled and proactive Data Modeller on behalf of our client, a major bank with a vision to realize dreams and help its customers achieve their goals. The bank serves over 10 million customers and has offices across Northern Europe. This position is based in central Stockholm.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze requirements for data-related projects.
