title: Mjukvaruarkitekt
description:
*Vill du ta ditt konsultande till nästa nivå hos en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vi vet vad du tänker. Du har hört det förut. Men tro oss, det har du inte. Vårt körsbär på konsulttårtan är något annat. Sök jobbet och smaka själv!* 




**Rollen** 




 Som Mjukvaruarkitekt kommer du att inneha en central roll i att definiera och skapa övergripande tekniska lösningar för komplexa mjukvaruprojekt. Du kommer att säkerställa att tekniska lösningar stödjer företagets mål och att systemarkitekturen är stabil, skalbar och säker. 
 



**Erfarenhet** 




 Du har en stark bakgrund inom mjukvaruutveckling samt arkitekturarbete i agila utvecklingsprocesser och har fördelaktigt moderniserat mjukvarulösningar förr.
   

 Vi ser även att du har:
   




* Bakgrund inom utveckling med erfarenhet av exempelvis Java, Python samt diverse ramverk
* Förmåga att förstå och översätta företagets strategiska mål till tekniska krav och lösningar.
* Design av systemarkitekturer med hänsyn till skalbarhet, prestanda och säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av molnbaserad arkitektur och tjänster som AWS, Azure och/eller Google Cloud.
* Kunskap kring Docker och Kubernetes
* Förståelse för säkerhetsaspekter inom mjukvaruarkitektur och datahantering



 Låter detta som du i det stora hela? Hör av dig, så tar vi upp dialogen redan under kommande vecka!
 



**Varför ska du välja oss?** 




 Här tror vi på frihet, möjligheter och medbestämmande. Att du som medarbetare ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas och forma ditt arbete utefter dina intressen och prioriteringar i livet. Att alla får vara med och forma och påverka bolaget genom delägarskap, advisory board och projektgrupper. Att det är viktigt att ha ett sammanhang, känna tillhörighet och att man har kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och tror på en.
 



**Om Castra** 




 Castra är en entreprenörsdriven konsultgrupp inom IT, management och systemutveckling. Bolaget ägs gemensamt av medarbetarna och tillsammans bygger vi det företag vi själva vill jobba på.
 



 Vår vision är att vi ska vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för konsulter. Att vi blivit certifierade av Great Place to Work® fem år i rad är ett bevis på våra höga mål kring företagskultur. Våra tankar om delaktighet, påverkansmöjligheter och respekt för individens egna val och möjligheter fungerar.
 



 Företaget har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Sundsvall, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida www.castra.se.
 



**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 
 Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta Charlotta.Ljung@castra.se Tfn: 072-871 63 12

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**Are you ready to bring the next generation of character animation tools to game developers worldwide—while working in a fast-moving startup at the forefront of Generative AI?** 




  





**This is your opportunity.** 




  





**At Motorica, we believe that words articulate thought, but motion expresses the soul. We are a cutting-edge startup operating at the intersection of Generative AI and entertainment, where creativity and deep-tech collide.** 




**About Motorica** 




  





**Our platform—recognized as a research and product leader in the emerging motion modality (one of the six fundamental generative AI modalities alongside image, video, audio, text, and geometry)—enables game studios to create dynamic, lifelike animation faster and more affordably than ever before.** 




  




* Our foundational model provides AAA quality animations used by some of the biggest names in gaming.



  




* We are currently onboarding multiple AAA+ game studios, that are currently building games with world-renowned IP, to use Motorica within their top titles.



  






 We’re a small, fast-moving team, so you can make a real difference from day one.
 





 What You’ll Do as a ML Engineer
 




  




* Immerse yourself in an academic-led environment where you’ll pioneer ML / Generative AI research within the motion field.



  




* Drive innovations to production, ensuring that creative people love to use the AI you help build.



  




* Collaborate with world-leading experts in generative modeling, breathing life into characters for gaming, entertainment, and beyond.



  




* Contribute to proprietary, state-of-the-art models, pushing the boundaries of what motion-generation technology can do.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




  




* Solid foundation in deep learning and probabilistic machine learning



  




* Excellent ability to implement innovations from machine-learning research papers, especially in deep generative modeling



  




* Strong software development skills (Python, PyTorch)



  




* Good command of spoken English and decent written English skills




 Meritorious Skills/Experience
 




  




* Experience implementing diffusion models (or flow matching, rectified flows, or consistency models)



  




* 3D animation and/or motion capture data expertise



  




* Published papers at conferences like SIGGRAPH or CVPR, or outstanding contributions to relevant open-source projects



  




* Other notable experience in deep generative modeling




 Potentially Useful Skills/Experience
 




  




* Signal-processing knowledge



  






 Personal Traits
 




  




* Intellectual curiosity – always questioning and exploring



  




* Strong team communication skills



  




* Hacker mentality – eager to get things working, but never sloppy



  




* Analytical and critical thinker – challenge us to think differently!



  






 Why You’ll Be Excited to Work Here
 




  




* We are world leaders in what we do, with a core focus on generative machine learning.



  




* We solve real problems—building AI that creative people in the gaming and entertainment industries love to use.



  




* You’ll work with a small and nimble team, which means fast decision-making and a chance to have a real impact.



  




* You’ll push the cutting edge with proprietary, state-of-the-art models that provide AAA quality animations.



  




* We’ve recently signed with top AAA studios, so your work will be part of globally recognized IP.



  





**Compensation and Benefits** 




  




* Retirement Plan



  




* Insurance Package



  




* Health Benefits (5000 SEK/year)



  




* Stock Options



  




* 6 weeks vacation



  





  






 Are you ready to take the leap, tackle real-world problems, and help shape how the world animates characters in games and beyond? Join Motorica, and let’s build the future of motion together.

title: Deep Learning Engineer
description:
At Univrses we develop computer vision and machine learning technology for smart cities, and self-driving vehicles. Univrses is now looking for a Deep Learning Engineer to join the team in Stockholm!
 



 Our product 3DAI™ revolutionizes urban and highway road management by providing timely, actionable insights about road conditions through AI powered live maps. As a result it empowers businesses, municipalities, and road transport authorities to make data-driven decisions, optimize their operations, and increase urban safety.
 



 The team consists of talented, hard-working, and friendly people from all over the world with diverse backgrounds and expert knowledge in computer vision, robotics, machine learning, physics, math, software development and more. We develop cutting edge technology, particularly in the fields of computer vision and deep learning.
 



  





**Your role** 




 You will be part of the team responsible for the data curation, computer vision, and deep learning components of 3DAI™.
 



 We are looking for a person who is knowledgeable in the state of the art in deep learning, and has a strong interest in applying their knowledge to real-world problems. They also recognize the importance of data quality and automation in building scalable, reliable systems, and are eager to contribute to the development of high-quality, user-friendly tools for these systems.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and test deep learning models for object detection, classification, and segmentation.
* Streamline the deployment and scaling of computer vision models in production environments.
* Design and implement monitoring and logging solutions to track the performance of our system on both controlled test sets and in the wild.
* Develop learning based methods to ease data curation and annotation through automation.
* Work closely with other teams to develop end to end KPIs for performance monitoring and trouble shooting.
* Optimize and scale ML infrastructure to handle large volumes of image data efficiently.



  





**Who you are** 



* Minimum of a Master's degree in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Robotics, or a related field.
* Over 5 years of proven experience in developing computer vision or deep learning technologies.
* Proficient in programming, particularly Python, and experienced with ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch).
* Strong theoretical foundation in deep learning and best practices.
* Solid understanding of version control systems, especially Git.
* Exceptional communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to thrive in a team-oriented environment.
* Self-motivated with a keen focus on quality and scalability.
* Motivated to see your ideas brought to life in production.
* Flexible, eager to learn, and excited to take on diverse tech challenges.



  





**Bonus points** 



* Knowledge of classical computer vision and projective geometry.
* Experience with data annotation and curation tools such as Labelbox, and Voxel 51.
* Experience with AWS and Serverless frameworks, or other cloud platforms.
* Experience with containerization and developing CI/CD pipelines.
* Experience with Jenkins.



  





**What we offer** 



* Bright and spacious facilities in the heart of Stockholm
* Open and friendly work environment
* A diverse, international, and friendly team
* Generous employee benefits, such as:
* Flexible work hours
* 5 000 SEK/year in wellness grant
* Pension plan
* Weekly Lunch and Learns
* Possibility to work from home and/or the office in Hammarby Kaj, Stockholm



  





**Next step** 




 If you are passionate about computer vision and deep learning and want to be part of our team, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience. All application material must be in English!

title: Ruby Developer
description:
**At Hemnet, we offer the opportunity to work on a wide range of challenges, from building scalable systems that handle high traffic to crafting payment solutions and contributing to domain modeling. You’ll be involved in every stage of the product development lifecycle—whether it's ideation, innovation, new development, or iteration. Your work will directly impact millions of users, as we deploy updates multiple times a day.**
 We run both Node.js and Rails applications in production, emphasizing the right tool for the job. Our tech stack includes OpenSearch, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, and Docker, among others. On the frontend, React is our go-to framework, paired with Next.js and TypeScript. We rely on AWS, using both Terraform and AWS CDK for hosting.
   

  

**How We Work**
**🧪 Embrace the Unknown – The Adventure Awaits! 🧪**
 At Hemnet, we love to experiment. With our vast user base, we can never predict exactly what our users will love. That's where you come in! Dare to explore uncharted territories, try something new, and surprise us all.
   

  

**⚗️ Lab Week: Unleash Your Inner Mad Scientist! ⚗️**
 Twice a year, we dedicate a Lab Week where you’ll have the freedom to explore exciting experiments. It’s your chance to dive into your own projects, explore new ideas, and share your results with the team. Innovation starts here!
   

  

**⚙️ Test, Test, and Test – Safety First! ⚙️**
 Delivering a high-performance experience is core to our development process. We prioritize rigorous automated testing to ensure the reliability and stability of our applications.
   

  

**👯 Pair Programming and Mob Sessions – Because We're Stronger Together 👯**
 We believe in the power of collaboration. Through pair programming and mob sessions, we combine our strengths, solve challenges, and share knowledge across teams.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We’re looking for an experienced Web Developer with a minimum of four years of professional experience building customer-facing applications in Ruby on Rails. In this role, you will primarily build and maintain backend services and contribute to impactful user features. You’re comfortable working across various technologies and frameworks, always choosing the best solution for the task at hand. If you thrive in a collaborative environment and love to innovate, this role is for you.
   

  

**Qualities We Look For**
* You have proven experience in software development, with a strong portfolio showcasing products you have worked on. You have a pragmatic and agile approach to software development, balancing quality and business needs.
* You are an effective communicator with skills and tools to collaborate within cross-functional teams.
* You take responsibility for both your growth and the development of those around you, always eager to learn and share new knowledge.


****Your career at Hemnet****
 With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
   

  

 Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
   

  

 With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.
   

  

 Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working**
 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.
   

  

 Shape your role, explore your curiosity, and express your creativity at Sweden's no. 1 property platform.
   

  

 Enjoy lab weeks, competence days, dev brekkies, brown bags, meetups and lots of cake.
   

  

 We tailor the tools to the task, with quick iterations and a strong focus on high quality.
   

  

* Ruby-on-Rails, JavaScript, Node.js, Typescript
* Next.js, Nest, React.js
* Postgres
* GraphQL
* GCP, AWS
* Docker


 Hemnet is Sweden’s largest property platform. Since the start in 1998, we have been the natural meeting place for real estate agents, property sellers and buyers. Hemnet offers the majority of properties for sale on the market; the largest number of potential buyers; products through which sellers are able to influence the selling of their property - and products that give real estate agents the opportunity to strengthen their brand. We are one of Sweden’s largest sites and apps, and one of the most popular property platforms in the world based on population.

title: QA Testare / Lead
description:
På Doktor.Se omdefinierar vi det svenska sjukvårdssystemet genom att göra det mer tillgängligt, smidigt och effektivt – utan att kompromissa med kvalitet eller säkerhet. Vår unika hybridmodell, som kombinerar fysiska vårdcentraler med moderna digitala lösningar, har gjort oss till den största digitala vårdgivaren i Sverige, med miljontals konsultationer varje år. Vi är också stolta över att vara en av de mest populära arbetsgivarna inom vården.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som vår första in-house QA Testare eller Lead kommer du att ansvara för alla aspekter kring kvalitetssäkring och testning av Doktor.Se-appen och plattformen bakom. Du kommer att ha en central roll i vår tech-organisation där du samarbetar nära utvecklare, designers och produktansvariga. Du kommer ha möjlighet att bestämma och påverka hur vi testar samt ta fram testplaner som tech-organisationen ska följa.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Du har minst 5 års erfarenhet med kvalitetssäkring och testning av mobil-appar, webb-appar och backend-system.
* Du har en passion för kvalitet och anser att testning är ett ansvar för alla i teamet.
* Du är van att arbeta i utvecklingsprojekt med agila processer och metoder. Du har även erfarenhet av komplexa systemlösningar.
* Du har erfarenhet med olika testverktyg och tagit fram testplaner samt motiverat utvecklare och andra att bry sig om kvalitén och testning.
* Du är flytande i både svenska och engelska och är bekväm med båda språken i ditt dagliga arbete.
* Gärna erfarenhet av testautomatisering och kunna sätta upp system för automatiserad testning i samarbete med andra utvecklare.
* Gärna branscherfarenhet inom hälso- och sjukvård.


**Vad vi erbjuder**
* Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning med inledande provanställning.
* Förmåner: 30 dagars semester, ITP1-pension, friskvårdsbidrag och personlig utvecklingsbudget.
* Utveckling: Möjlighet att arbeta med meningsfulla projekt och växa professionellt.
* Arbetsmiljö: Ett samarbetsinriktat team och ett modernt kontor på Sveavägen 63 i Stockholm.


**Ansökningsprocess**
* Startdatum: Så snart som möjligt, med hänsyn till uppsägningstid.
* Bakgrundskontroll: Vi kräver utdrag ur belastningsregistret och ID-kontroll.
* Ansökan: Sök genom att bifoga ditt CV.


**Var med och revolutionera vården!**
 Om du brinner för att utveckla ny teknik som hjälper människor och vill arbeta i en agil miljö med hög grad av självständighet, vill vi gärna höra från dig!
   

  

 --
   

  

 Konsulter, rekryterare och jobbsiter undanbedes vänligt. Vi kommer inte besvara ansökningar via mejl på grund av GDPR.
   

  

 På Doktor.Se vill vi göra saker annorlunda. Vi vill utmana och förändra en hel bransch. Allt började med en idé om att det måste gå att skapa en vårdlösning som är bättre anpassad till vår tid och våra behov. Att det måste gå att få moderna digitala verktyg och traditionell fysisk vård att samverka med utgångspunkt i patientens behov. Och att göra det så att det inte bara blir tillgängligt för våra patienter utan också bidrar till att utveckla det sätt som vård erbjuds på idag. För oss alla. Det här är faktiskt vad vi gör idag. Men vi är långt ifrån klara och är ute på en spännande förändringsresa. Där kan du få vara med och bidra.

title: Principal Level Designer | New Games
description:
**Craft:**
 Games Design & Production
   

  

**Job Description:**
 King is one of the most successful mobile companies in the world, entertaining millions of players every day, and we are always looking for people who are as excited as we are about making it even bigger and better.
   

  

 As a Principal Puzzle Level Designer working in a talented cross- functional team, you will play a key role in the development and delivery of new and exciting experiences for our players.
   

  

 We’re looking for an experienced, highly motivated, collaboration-orientated 2D Principal Level Designer to help drive the development of a flagship puzzle title. If you want to contribute to creating an amazing brand-new experience for millions of players to enjoy on the go, then this is the right job for you!
   

  

 As part of the New Games team, you will help shape, and develop the next generation of King’s games, playing a key part in leading the creation of well-balanced, consistent, and thrilling levels.
   

  

 Your role within our Kingdom
   

  

* Drive ‘Best in Market’ level design for a key puzzle title at King.
* Maintain the highest possible levels of level design quality, while respecting technical limitations and performance targets
* Collect, analyze, and utilize data and user feedback as part of the iterative process of improvement to your level designs
* Establish level design best practice guidelines and workflows.
* Create task breakdowns to assist with scheduling
* Track and report key issues and risks to production and project management departments
* Develop pipelines and processes to allow efficient and effective delivery of game environments, both for launch and as the game grows as a service
* Stay up to date with industry techniques, standards, and workflows, aware of current & upcoming game titles & technology
* Set the standard for the team in terms of level creation, quality assessment, and best practices as you create, assess, balance, and tune new and existing levels.
* Support your team in continuously improving workflow and process efficiency.
* Be the go-to expert for any questions around level design, content cadence, balancing strategy, what decisions should be taken based on your understanding and analysis of the data, and what actions are needed to ensure that the game is competitive in a rapidly changing industry.
* Work closely with Team Leadership, Developers, Creatives, and Data Scientists to shape new features and contribute to creative discussions.


 Skills to create thrills
   

  

* Experience and knowledge and expertise around level design processes for puzzle games.
* A great passion for games, understanding of the casual market, and, of course, understanding what makes a great game!
* Experience working within a game production team and/or knowledge of game production best practices.
* Strong design (layout) skills and experience.
* Experience using qualitative and quantitative data to improve level designs.
* Confidence and experience to self-manage and self-motivate
* Experience working on mobile as a gaming platform and F2P games
* Articulate with strong written and verbal communication skills


**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
The Personalization team makes deciding what to play next easier and more enjoyable for every listener. From Blend to Discover Weekly, we’re behind some of Spotify’s most-loved features. We built them by understanding the world of music and podcasts better than anyone else. Join us and you’ll keep millions of users listening by making great recommendations to each and every one of them. We ask that our team members be physically located in Central European time or Eastern Standard/Daylight time zones for the purposes of our collaboration hours.
   

  

 The Speak team is Spotifies in-house text-to-speech (TTS) team, supporting products like DJ, AI Voice Translation, as well as the development of exciting new unreleased products. We focus on building world class speech technologies that can power the next generation of personalized generative voice products at scale.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Build large-scale speech and audio data pipelines using frameworks like Google Cloud Platform and Apache Beam
* Work on machine learning projects powering new generative AI experiences and helping to build state-of-the-art text-to-speech models
* Learn and contribute to the teams best practices and techniques for building data pipelines for large scale generative models, including cleaning, filtering, classifying and labelling
* Collaborate with other engineers, researchers, product managers and stakeholders, taking on learning and leadership opportunities that arise
* Deliver scalable, testable, maintainable, and high-quality code
* Share knowledge, promote standard methodologies, making your team the best version of itself through mentorship and constructive accountability.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You have Data Engineering experience and you know how to work with high-volume, heterogeneous data, preferably with distributed systems such as Hadoop, BigTable, Cassandra, GCP, AWS
* You have experience building clean, high quality datasets for training large scale machine learning models, a focus on audio data is preferred
* You have experience with one or more higher-level Python or Java based data processing frameworks such as Beam, Dataflow, Crunch, Scalding, Storm, Spark etc
* You have strong Python programming abilities. You might have worked with Docker as well as Luigi, Airflow, or similar tools
* You care about quality and you know what it means to ship high quality code
* You have experience managing data retention policies
* You care about agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and responsible experimentation
* You understand the value of collaboration and partnership within teams
* You have experience in developing datasets tailored for training high-performance machine learning models.
* Familiarity with generative models or audio-based machine learning applications is highly desirable.
* You are proficient in cleaning, filtering, and evaluating dataset quality, leveraging both pre-trained and in-house machine learning models, as well as human evaluation techniques, to ensure optimal quality.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! For this role, you can be within the UK region as long as we have a work location.
* This team operates within the GMT time zone for collaboration.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Analytics Engineer
description:
Om rollen
   

  

**Bli en nyckelspelare i framtidens dataanalys på Sopra Steria!**
 Vill du arbeta på spännande konsultuppdrag där du får möjligheten att forma datadrivna lösningar och visualisera insikter i moderna BI-verktyg? Vi söker flera
 **Analytics Engineers** 
 som brinner för att tillgängliggöra data för verksamheten genom analys, visualisering och strategisk rådgivning. Har du några års erfarenhet och vill fortsätta utvecklas, eller är du en senior profil som letar efter nästa stora utmaning? Vi letar efter dig!
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
* Uppdrag hos ledande företag och organisationer, där du arbetar med modern dataanalys och BI-utveckling i Power BI och Azure.
* Möjlighet att påverka hela analyskedjan – från datainsamling och modellering till visualisering och beslutsstöd.
* En roll där du får driva arbetet hos kunder och vara en nyckelspelare i tvärfunktionella team.
* En kultur där vi delar kunskap, utvecklar varandra och håller oss i framkant av tekniken.


**Som Analytics Engineer Kommer Du Att**
* Utveckla rapporter och visualiseringar i Power BI och andra BI-verktyg.
* Arbeta med datamodellering och transformationer i Azure-miljöer.
* Bidra till att migrera on-premise-lösningar till molnet.
* Samarbeta i hela utvecklingscykeln – från idé och kravställning till utveckling, testning och förvaltning.
* Utveckla skalerbara och framtidssäkra datalösningar som stödjer affärsbeslut.


**Din profil**
 Vi söker både
 **juniora och seniora profiler** 
 , där erfarenhetsnivån avgör vilka arbetsuppgifter och ansvar du får.
   

  

**Junior Profil**
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av analys, BI-utveckling eller liknande roller.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga rapporter i Power BI eller andra BI-verktyg.
* Grundläggande förståelse för SQL och databashantering.


**Senior Profil**
* Minst 5–7 års erfarenhet inom dataanalys, BI eller data engineering.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av datamodellering, ETL-processer och cloud-lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av att leda projekt och coacha kollegor.


**Tekniska Färdigheter**
* Power BI (krav) – erfarenhet av olika typer av installationer.
* Azure, SQL, databashantering och datamodellering.
* Meriterande: Erfarenhet av Qlik, Tableau, Data Engineering, AI och Data Science.


**Varför välja oss?**
 Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du kan arbeta flexibelt, utvecklas inom
 **teknik och innovation** 
 och ingå i ett team av
 **kompetenta och engagerade kollegor** 
 . Här får du möjlighet att arbeta med
 **spännande uppdrag hos några av Sveriges ledande företag** 
 och bidra till att skapa
 **framtidens Business Intelligence-lösningar** 
 .
   

  

 Ansök idag och bli en del av Sopra Steria! 🚀
   

  

 Ytterligare information
   

  

 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer (Bangkok-Based, Relocation Provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know Our Team**
 The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.
   

  

**Why Agoda Data DevOps Team?**
 Our systems scale across multiple data centers, totalling a few million writes per second and managing tens of petabytes of data. We deal with problems from real-time data-ingestion, replication, enrichment, storage and analytics. We are not just using Big Data technologies; we are pushing them to the edge.
   

  

 Join us in the team that handles our Data Lake, a crucial platform that serves a wide range of business critical needs and applications from being used to train ML models for user-facing applications, to enabling reporting and monitoring, to empowering Product Owners to do research and experimentation hypothesis. The data lake is the very heart of our data-driven culture and spans hundreds of servers across multiple data centers at tens of PB scale.
   

  

**In this Role, you will get to**
* Improve scalability, stability, accuracy, speed and efficiency of our existing Data Platform
* Build, administer and scale Data Platform
* Be comfortable navigating the following technology stack: S3, Kubernetes, KubeFlow, Spark, SQL, Impala, Scala, java, Python, scripting (Bash/Python) etc.
* Work with experienced engineers to identify and build tools to automate many large-scale data platform management


**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science /Information Systems/Engineering/related field
* 2+ years of experience in Kubernetes Administration
* Familiarity with on-premise platform
* Good experience in Apache Spark performance tuning and debugging
* Good level understanding of JVM and either Java or Scala
* Experience in WorkFlow Scheduler eg. KubeFlow, AirFlow, Oozie etc.
* SQL experience eg. SparkSql, Impala, BigQuery, Presto/Trino, StarRocks etc.
* Experience debugging and reasoning about production issues is desirable
* Analytical problem-solving capabilities & experience.
* Systems administration skills in Linux


**It’s great if you have**
* Experience working with Open-source products
* Python/Shell scripting skills
* Working in an agile environment using test driven methodologies

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Senior Data Engineer, Analytical Data Services
description:
*Digital Customer Offering (DCO) is a business function within Fortum Consumer Solutions, where business and technology come together. At DCO, we create superior digital offerings and experiences for our 2,4 million consumer and enterprise customers. We innovate and find new ways to digitalize our offerings and processes. We collaborate closely with our stakeholders and external partners. Through cross-functional collaboration, agility and sustainability focus, we strive to make our customers’ increasingly digital lives easier with our services. We serve clients in the Nordics as well as Poland and Spain.*
 We are looking for talented and passionate individuals to join our Secure Operations & Data Solutions unit! This role involves overseeing data engineering activities in your responsibility area, such as Analytical Data Products. You will build data processing frameworks, work with data architects, and strive to continuously develop new and improved data engineering capabilities. Our team is committed to pursuing innovation and improvements through increased use of data. United by our passion for technology, curiosity about user experience, and dedication to excellence, we are looking for someone who shares our enthusiasm.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Provide senior-level contribution to a team that is responsible for the design, deployment, and maintenance of the business’s data platforms.
* Implement strategies directed at acquiring data and promoting the development of new insights across the business.
* Monitor existing metrics, analyze data, and lead partnerships with other Data and Analytics teams to identify and implement system and process improvements.
* Design, architect, implement, and support key datasets that avail structured and timely access to actionable business insights.


**To excel in this role, you are expected to be:**
* A master’s or bachelor’s degree holder in computer science.
* Experienced with more than 5 years of relevant experience in IT and business/industry.
* Experienced in leading Data Engineer work.
* Knowledgeable about Data platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and their main tools (DataBricks, Data Lake, DataFactory, Delta Lake).
* Knowledgeable about databases (e.g., SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle).
* Knowledgeable about SW version control tools.
* Experienced with ETL/ELT processes.


 We are excited to hire ian ndividual who are passionate about data engineering and eager to contribute to our innovative team. If you share our enthusiasm, we would love to hear from you!
   

  

**Ready to Join Us?**
 Don't miss out on this exciting opportunity! Submit your application by 14.03.2025 at the latest. We work with an ongoing selection and the job ad might be closed before the final application date. If you have any questions or would like to learn more about the position, feel free to reach out to Antti Heimonen by phone or via email at antti.heimonen@fortum.com. We're here to help and look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Staff Data Engineer – Kafka Expert (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know Our Team**
 The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 As senior data pipeline engineer, you will work on distributed systems spanning multiple data centers, thousands of servers and hundreds of billions of messages a day. Ensuring data quality, data integrity and data accuracy is a core part of our identity. Design for new scalable system which data is increasing day by day, including auditing and monitoring systems. You will have a chance to manage projects with small team of 1-2 members which improving your ownership and leadership. You will be eager to solve problems that come from managing and making sense of large amounts of data. Some of the things you’ll get to work on include schema registry, real-time data-ingestion, cross data center replication, enrichment, storage and analytics of the data flow.
   

  

 We are a small passionate team and we are looking for exceptional individuals to be a part of designing, building, deploying (and probably debugging) our Data Pipeline.
   

  

**In This Role, You’ll Get to**
* You will build, administer and scale data pipelines that process hundreds of billions of messages a day spanning over multiple data centers
* You will develop and expand upon existing frameworks that is used by Teams throughout Agoda to produce messages to the data pipeline
* You will build and manage data ingestion into multiple systems (Hadoop, ElasticSearch, other Distributed Systems)
* You will build tools that monitor high data accuracy SLAs for the data pipeline
* You will explore available new technologies that improve upon our quality of data, processes and data flow
* You will develop quality software through design review, code reviews and test driven development


**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Information Systems / Computer Engineering or related field
* 8 plus years of industry experience, preferred at a tech company
* Good knowledge of data architecture principles
* Have operational experience debugging production issues
* An experienced coder, who can stand your ground with experience building systems with purpose that are flexible, well-tested, maintainable and scale
* You’re detail oriented considering every outcome of a particular decision
* You can communicate in technical English with fluidity, both verbal and written
* Know more than one programming language (Golang, Java, Scala, Python, C#, etc.)
* Good understanding of how Kafka works
* Kafka Administrator Experience
* Experience with data ingestion from Kafka into Hadoop, ElasticSearch, other Distributed Systems

title: Senior Data Engineer – Kafka Expert (Bangkok based, relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know Our Team**
 The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases, queue systems, BI tools, and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users, product managers, engineers, and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it, and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department, but also the reward.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 As senior data pipeline engineer, you will work on distributed systems spanning multiple data centers, thousands of servers and hundreds of billions of messages a day. Ensuring data quality, data integrity and data accuracy is a core part of our identity. Design for new scalable system which data is increasing day by day, including auditing and monitoring systems. You will have a chance to manage projects with small team of 1-2 members which improving your ownership and leadership. You will be eager to solve problems that come from managing and making sense of large amounts of data. Some of the things you’ll get to work on include schema registry, real-time data-ingestion, cross data center replication, enrichment, storage and analytics of the data flow.
   

  

 We are a small passionate team and we are looking for exceptional individuals to be a part of designing, building, deploying (and probably debugging) our Data Pipeline.
   

  

**In This Role, You’ll Get to**
* You will build, administer and scale data pipelines that process hundreds of billions of messages a day spanning over multiple data centers
* You will develop and expand upon existing frameworks that is used by Teams throughout Agoda to produce messages to the data pipeline
* You will build and manage data ingestion into multiple systems (Hadoop, ElasticSearch, other Distributed Systems)
* You will build tools that monitor high data accuracy SLAs for the data pipeline
* You will explore available new technologies that improve upon our quality of data, processes and data flow
* You will develop quality software through design review, code reviews and test driven development


**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science / Information Systems / Computer Engineering or related field
* 4 plus years of industry experience, preferred at a tech company
* Good knowledge of data architecture principles
* Have operational experience debugging production issues
* An experienced coder, who can stand your ground with experience building systems with purpose that are flexible, well-tested, maintainable and scale
* You’re detail oriented considering every outcome of a particular decision
* You can communicate in technical English with fluidity, both verbal and written
* Know more than one programming language (Golang, Java, Scala, Python, C#, etc.)
* Good understanding of how Kafka works
* Kafka Administrator Experience
* Experience with data ingestion from Kafka into Hadoop, ElasticSearch, other Distributed Systems
* Strong systems administration skills in Linux
* Worked on or contributed to Open Source Project
